page.title: 01THE PENNARD AREA.
page.content: OUR AREA IS SEMI-RURAL AND INCLUDES THE VILLAGES OF PENNARD, SOUTHGATE, PENMAEN AND NICHOLASTON. THE LAND COVER IS DIVERSE - SEA AND LIMESTONE CLIFFS IN THE SOUTH, UPLAND COMMON LAND IN THE NORTH, AND PASTURE AND SOME ARABLE LAND IN THE SOUTH-WEST AND EAST.THERE ARE ALSO ESTATES OF PRIVATE HOUSES WHICH PROVIDE HOMES FOR THE MAINLY MIDDLE CLASS FAMILIES. THE MAJORITY OF THE WORKING POPULATION COMMUTE TO SWANSEA EACH DAY. THE AREA CHANGES CHARACTER ACCORDING TO THE SEASON.IN THE SUMMER LARGE NUMBERS OF TOURISTS ENTER THE AREA FOR THE ATTRACTIONS OF THE COUNTRYSIDE AND SPLENDID SEASHORE - IT WAS THE FIRST AREA IN BRITAIN TO BE DESIGNATED AN" {AREA OF OUTSTANDING NATURAL BEAUTY"} DURING THE WINTER MONTHS ITS CHARACTER IS THAT OF A RELATIVELY QUIET SEMI_ RURAL DORMITORY DISTRICT.
